definitions: Past tense and past participle of spill: to cause or allow (liquid) to flow over the edge of its container, especially unintentionally.
Past tense and past participle of spill: to shed (blood).
Past tense and past participle of spill: to cause (contents) to fall out of a container.
Past tense and past participle of spill: to reveal (a secret).
examples: She spilt coffee on her new dress.
The blood spilt on the battlefield.
He spilt the beans about the surprise party.
The bag was torn and the contents spilt everywhere.
